Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) can directly operate on hydrocarbon fuels such as natural gas; however, the widely used nickel-based anodes face grand challenges such as coking, sulfur poisoning, and redox instability.
Titulo: Redox-Reversible Electrode Material for Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: We report a novel double perovskite oxide Sr2Co0.4Fe1.2Mo0.4O6-delta (SCFM) that possesses excellent redox reversibility and can be used as both the cathode and the anode.
Titulo: Redox-Reversible Electrode Material for Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: When heat-treated at 900 degrees C in a reducing environment, double perovskite phase SCFM transforms into a composite of the Ruddlesden-Popper structured oxide Sr3Co0.1Fe1.3Mo0.6O7-delta (RP SCFM) with the Co-Fe alloy nanoparticles homogeneously distributed on the surface of RP-SCFM.
Titulo: Redox-Reversible Electrode Material for Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: At 900 degrees C in an oxidizing atmosphere, the composite transforms back into the double perovskite phase SCFM.
Titulo: Redox-Reversible Electrode Material for Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The excellent oxygen reduction reaction catalytic activity and mixed ionic-electronic conductivity make SCFM an excellent cathode material for SOFCs.
Titulo: Redox-Reversible Electrode Material for Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: When SCFM is used as the anode, excellent performance and stability are achieved upon either direct oxidation of methane as a fuel or operation with sulfur-containing fuels.
Titulo: Redox-Reversible Electrode Material for Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The excellent redox reversibility coupled with outstanding electrical and catalytic properties manifested by SCFM will enable a broad application in energy conversion applications.
Titulo: Redox-Reversible Electrode Material for Direct Hydrocarbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
